  • Field Details

    • upperTail

      static double[][] upperTail
      a table of upper-tail critical values of the chi-squared distribution where columns are the limit probabilities and rows are the degrees of freedom. The values are a member of the variate X. A quantile is a range within the set of X. One can reject the null hypothesis if the test statistic is greater than the tabled value.

    • lowerTail

      static double[][] lowerTail
      a table of lower-tail critical values of the chi-squared distribution where columns are the limit probabilities and rows are the degrees of freedom (+1 as first row is 0). The values are a member of the variate X. A quantile is a range within the set of X. One can reject the null hypothesis if the computed test statistic is less than the tabled value.

  • Constructor Details

    • ChiSquaredCriticalValues

      public ChiSquaredCriticalValues()

  • Method Details

    • upperTailStatistic

      public static double upperTailStatistic(ChiSquaredCriticalValues.PROB_UT probability, int degreesOfFreedom)
      find the upper-tail critical value to compare to a test statistic. One can reject the null hypothesis if the computed test statistic is greater than the table value.
      Parameters:
      probability - the probability to look-up in the table. e.g. for a one-sided test, this probability is the same as 1 minus the significance level alpha. For a two-sided test, this probability is the same as the significance level 1 minus alpha/2.
      degreesOfFreedom -
      Returns:

    • lowerTailStatistic

      public static double lowerTailStatistic(ChiSquaredCriticalValues.PROB_LT probability, int degreesOfFreedom)
      find the lower-tail critical value to compare to a test statistic. One can reject the null hypothesis if the computed test statistic is less than the table value.
      Parameters:
      probability - the probability to look-up in the table. e.g. for a one-sided test, this probability is the same as the significance level alpha. For a two-sided test, this probability is the same as the significance level alpha/2.
      degreesOfFreedom -
      Returns:

    • approxPValueLin

      public static double approxPValueLin(double chisqStat, int degreesOfFreedom)
      Calculate the p-value of a chi-squared statistic. from "Approximating the cumulative chi-squared distribution and it's inverse" 1988, Lin, J.T., The Statistician 37, 3-5 https://www.jstor.org/stable/2348373?seq=1#metadata_info_tab_contents
      Parameters:
      chisqStat -
      degreesOfFreedom -
      Returns:

    • approxChiSqStatLin

      public static double approxChiSqStatLin(double p, int degreesOfFreedom)
      Calculate the chi-squared statistic given the upper tail p-value. from "Approximating the cumulative chi-squared distribution and it's inverse" 1988, Lin, J.T., The Statistician 37, 3-5 https://www.jstor.org/stable/2348373?seq=1#metadata_info_tab_contents
      Parameters:
      p - the p-value OR (1-p)
      degreesOfFreedom -
      Returns:
